Module frogger
Package frogger.model.actor.movableActor

Class MovableActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.image.ImageView
        • frogger.model.actor.Actor
          • frogger.model.actor.movableActor.MovableActor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Frog, Log, Obstacle, Snake, Turtle, WetTurtle
    public abstract class MovableActor
extends Actor

    MovableActor

    The MovableActor class is an abstract class contains the shared constructor and method

    The MovableActor class contains the constructor to set the initial position of instance, the move(double, double) controls the move of instance, the checkWall(double, int, int, int) method to check the boundary of move. The getIntersectingObjects(Class) method which return the arrayList contains the MovableActor instances touched. Also two abstract method act(long) and checkTouch() needed to be extended.

    Note: : MovableActor classes are not allowed to be instantiated thus it's need to be extended

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wenzheng Shan
    See Also:
    Actor, Frog, Log, Obstacle, Turtle, WetTurtle

    • Field Detail

      • speed

        private double speed

        The speed of objects auto-move

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovableActor

        public MovableActor()
        The constructor of MovableActor class do nothing and only used to be extended

      • MovableActor

        public MovableActor​(double xpos,
                    double ypos,
                    double s)

        The constructor of MovableActor class to set the position of instance and the speed of instance.

        Using this constructor need to call the function of super().

        Parameters:
        xpos - the X position of object
        ypos - the Y position of object
        s - the speed of object

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move​(double dx,
                 double dy)

        Controls the automatic movement of object.

        This method will be called in act(long) in every frame

        Parameters:
        dx - The distance of X position of each move
        dy - The distance of Y position of each move

      • checkWall

        public void checkWall​(double speed,
                      int leftPos,
                      int newLeftPos,
                      int newRightPos)

        Check the wall touch condition and reset the position of object.

        This method will be called in act(long) in every frame.

        This function will do the following task: If the object move right and touch the right wall, set its X position to newLeftPos, If the object move left and touch the left wall, set its X position to newRightPos.

        Parameters:
        speed - The speed of object. This parameter used to check the direction of object moving
        leftPos - The left boundary of object moving
        newLeftPos - The new X position of object when touching the right wall
        newRightPos - The new Y position of object when touching the left wall

      • getIntersectingObjects

        public <A extends Actor> java.util.List<A> getIntersectingObjects​(java.lang.Class<A> cls)

        returns all the instances that collide with instance who call this method and the class of those instances is cls.

        Type Parameters:
        A - The class extend from Actor
        Parameters:
        cls - All the instance that collide with the instance who call this method
        Returns:
        A List contains all the instances that collide with instance who call this method and the class of those instances is cls

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed()
        Returns the speed in this MovableActor.
        Returns:
        the speed in this MovableActor.

      • act

        public abstract void act​(long now)

        An abstract method that will be called by ActAnimation in every frame to perfrom some operation.

        Note: This is an abstract method and is designed to be overridden in the subclass of MovableActor

        Parameters:
        now - The current time of calling method.

      • checkTouch

        public abstract void checkTouch()

        An abstract method that will check the touch of other object (e.g., Log will call this method to check whether touch with Frog).

        Note: This is an abstract method and is designed to be overridden in the subclass of MovableActor
